Content:: The COVID-19 vaccination campaign in Bosnia and Herzegovina is a mass immunization campaign that was put in place by the Bosnian authorities in order to respond to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. It started on 12 February 2021.[1] As of 29 January 2022, 943,394 people have received the first dose, 846,080 people have received the second dose and 135,476 people have received the third dose.[2] There are five types of COVID-19 vaccines currently being used in Bosnia and Herzegovina. As of 25 January 2022, 3,948,830 vaccines doses have arrived to the country.[3] This article about COVID-19 vaccines is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. This Bosnia and Herzegovina-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
